section.section:
The statewide voter registration application shall:
require the signature of the applicant, subject to the penalties of perjury, by which the applicant swears or affirms that the information contained in the registration application is true and that the applicant meets all of the qualifications to become a registered voter;
state the penalties for the submission of a false application; and
provide the applicant with the opportunity to cancel a current registration.

The statewide voter registration application may not require:
notarization or other formal authentication; or
any additional information, other than the information necessary to enable election officials to determine the eligibility of the applicant and to administer voter registration and other parts of the election process.
A statewide voter registration application shall be produced exclusively by the State Board.
No other registration form may be used for registration purposes except:

text.section: The voter registration application form prescribed pursuant to the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 shall be accepted by the appropriate election official for purposes of voter registration.
The application described in this section may be used by a registered voter to change the voter's name, address, or party affiliation.
